file_content.text: Thank you, stranger. We all owe you our lives.
Is it... is it over? Are they all dead?
Affirmative, all clear.
Since they were never technically alive, I settled for blowing them apart.
Dead as droids can be.
Don't start thanking me all at once.
Would we be here otherwise?
You did it! You really did it! We're safe, Benett, we're safe!
Ungh... good. Good.
We owe you our lives. I wish there was some way we could repay you.
No need--just doing my job.
You're a true hero. I'll never forget what you've done here today. None of us will.
You could always pay me.
Of course! Yes, here, I'll collect credits from everyone. Everyone! Everyone, listen!
These soldiers saved our lives. Please, anything you can spare to reward them would mean a lot.
You will be documenting and forwarding this type-four income to our CO for appropriate allocation, won't you, Lieutenant?
I'll be sure to keep my paperwork up-to-date, Sergeant.
Yes, of course.
Very good, Lieutenant.
Thanks for spoiling the fun, Dorne.
I guess I will now.
It's not "fun," Lieutenant, it's profiteering.
Haven't you ever heard of "supplementary income"?
Not a chance.
I believe the words you're looking for are "unlawful solicitation of civilians, punishable by seven to ten months imprisonment," Lieutenant.
Nice. Never know when Command might tighten the expense account. But we'd better not advertise--this sort of thing is against regs.
I like to think I'm pretty resourceful.
Thanks, Sergeant.
A good idea is a good idea, boss.
If you can keep a secret, so can I, Sergeant.
Regs or no, we need the money.
If you go blabbing about this, I won't be happy.
Keep your mouth shut, then.
My lips are sealed.
Good people of Tatooine! As representatives of the Galactic Republic, we're honored to receive your donations. They will help combat tyranny across the galaxy!
This soldier saved our lives--whatever you can spare for a reward, please, let's show some gratitude.
There you go, stranger. I'm sorry it isn't more, but hopefully it will help you save other people like us down the line.
Your support is appreciated, ma'am.
Thank you very much.
Our pleasure.
We'll get by.
This is it?
I know you deserve so much more, but this is all we have to give.
I'm sure a pretty girl like you could think of some way to reward me.
Maybe an "alternative" reward?
Lieutenant! Soliciting payment of this nature is a clear violation of any number of service codes and protocols!
Don't worry, Elara. I won't let her come between us.
Jealous?
I--you--this isn't--Lieutenant! This behavior is utterly inappropriate for an officer of the Army of the Galactic Republic!
You don't call the shots, Dorne. I do.
Who's in charge here?
Perhaps so, sir. But regulations apply to all of us, regardless of rank.
You've got to be kidding me. Lieutenant, I don't remember this being on the mission objective list.
You're right, Sergeant.
Maybe this isn't on your objective list, Jorgan, but it's always on mine.
So what?
The job we've got is way too big to be wasting time here, Lieutenant.
This is my op, Jorgan--not yours.
You aren't in charge here.
Don't be ridiculous. We've got a job to do, and all we're doing here is wasting time.
Very insightful, sir--her inoffensive aesthetics make her an excellent candidate for promotional materials. She could tell her story of Republic heroism firsthand for the masses!
Yes. What the droid said. That's what I meant.
Oh, yes, of course.
I, uh, I don't think I'd be ready for anything like that just yet.
Promotional materials aren't exactly what I had in mind, Forex.
That isn't what I meant.
Really? I don't understand, why would you--
Quiet, 4X.
My apologies, Lieutenant. But it really is a brilliant idea!
I, uh, I hadn't... I didn't really think of--of anything like that. And, uh, well, there's really nowhere for us to go, uh, privately, now.
We, uh, we should really be getting Benett and these others to a med center. Farewell to you, soldier.
Just try not to get blown up again, I'm a busy woman.
I don't need your gratitude.
Um, o--okay. We'll, uh, we'll do our best.
Thanks again, stranger.
Aaaahh!
Ungh... wha... who, who's there?
Just hang in there, Benett. I'm Cana, I'm your neighbor, remember? You... you're going to be okay. Just try not to move, all right?
Uh, o--okay, sure. But, but my leg... ungh....
Don't worry, you'll be safe now.
Help is here.
Hear that, Benett? You're going to be just fine.
Did anyone see what happened?
I'm... I'm not sure, it all happened so fast.
Who isn't too busy dying to tell me what happened here?
I need answers, people.
I can see to this man's wounds. Sir? Can you hear me? I need you to tell me your name, sir.
Wh--what? I--I'm Benett. Are you a doctor?
Is he... will he be alright? Can you take care of him?
The sergeant will get your friend patched up.
He's in good hands.
She's a medic, not a miracle worker.
Don't get your hopes up.
I'll have this man stabilized momentarily, but he will still require rapid evacuation to the nearest medical facility.
Thank goodness. We're so lucky you arrived when you did.
Were you here when the bomb went off, ma'am?
Did you see what happened?
I--I was outside. I'd just stepped out, and all of a sudden I'm facedown in the sand half a block away.
I--I think I'm the only person who lives here who wasn't hurt. I was just up the street, heading for the market....
One second I was walking, the next I was facedown in the street. I didn't even see the explosion--I just felt it.
You're lucky to be alive, ma'am.
Sounds like a close call.
Yes, I... if I'd left just a few seconds later, I'd have still been inside.
Why would someone attack this building?
This doesn't make sense.
I--I don't know. I can't think of any reason at all. It's just an apartment building!
Gone just before the bomb blew. Lucky you.
Awfully convenient timing.
Wh--what do you mean? Are you accusing me of doing this? Why would I ever do such a thing?
Droid... it was a droid. Walked in the f--front door and boom--everything went white.
A bomb hidden inside a droid... no wonder no one saw it coming.
Sneaky, very sneaky.
Y--yes, I--I'm sure of it.
Hard to believe a single droid could do so much damage.
Must've been a huge blast.
That's... th--that's what I saw.
What'd you give this guy, Dorne?
Is he hallucinating?
A standard three-by-three perigen patch, Lieutenant--nothing that would cause hallucinations or disorientation.
You're in shock, sir, you could've seen anything.
You don't know what you saw.
I--I know what I s--saw... I'm sure of it.
Oh... oh no... oh no, no, no, no! Over there! In the doorway!
